title: Data on individual churches
text: Get tidy data Church England churches.
code: coe_churches(where = "ChurchCode = 608186") |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 11 #> $ church_code       <int> 608186 #> $ parish_name       <chr> "Leytonstone: St Margaret w St Columba" #> $ parish_code       <int> 580186 #> $ benefice_name     <chr> "Leytonstone St Marg w St Columba" #> $ benefice_id       <chr> "08/265 M" #> $ deanery_name      <chr> "WALTHAM FOREST" #> $ deanery_id        <int> 58108 #> $ archdeaconry_name <chr> "WEST HAM" #> $ archdeaconry_id   <int> 581 #> $ diocese_name      <chr> "Chelmsford" #> $ diocese_number    <int> 8

title: Data on individual churches
text: Get parish code number churches.

title: Data on individual churches
text: tiny function returns names fields used Feature Server Churches provided CoE Data Services ESRI.
code: coe_esri_fields() #>  [1] "FID"        "ChurchCode" "ChurchName" "ACNY_url"   "ACNY_id"    #>  [6] "Heritg_url" "LBGrade"    "ParLocNa"   "ParLegNa"   "ParishID"   #> [11] "BenefNa"    "BenefID"    "DeanNa"     "DeanID"     "ArchdNa"    #> [16] "ArchdID"    "DioNa"      "DioID"

title: Reading CoE statistics
text: coe_census_datasets() displays information census datasets available package. default, function returns two-column tibble including ons_id description, setting description = FALSE return character vector valid ONS ids can passed functions coe_census(). Parish-level datasets produced Ken Eames, Senior Statistical Researcher Church England’s Data Services team. original datasets available Church England website. package uses data last updated November 2024. notice source data since updated, please create Github issue https://github.com/Church-Army/coedata
code: coe_census_datasets() |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 15 #> Columns: 2 #> $ ons_id      <chr> "TS001", "TS004", "TS007A", "TS021", "TS030", "TS037", "TS… #> $ description <chr> "TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and commu…

what: Obtain census statistics for a parish, diocese, or the nation with coe_census()
title: Reading CoE statistics
text: Get statistics particular topic, particular geographical level, filtering required. Levels include ‘parish’, ‘diocese’ ‘england’. Parishes can filtered parish codes dioceses diocese numbers, national-level tables comprised single row filtered.
code: coe_census(ons_id =  "TS001", level = "england") #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   population lives_in_a_household lives_in_a_communal_establishment #>        <dbl>                <dbl>                             <dbl> #> 1   56490048             55504302                            985746 coe_census(ons_id = "TS001", level = "diocese", areas = 1) #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   diocese_name diocese_number population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>                 <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 Bath & Wells              1     980098               960221 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

title: Reading CoE statistics
text: convenient wrapper around coe_census() getting parish-level statistics parishes choosing
code: coe_census_parish(ons_id = "TS062", parish_codes = "350041", relative = TRUE) #> ✔ Reading from coedata_parish-data. #> ✔ Range ''TS062''. #> Church of England Census Data #> TS062 - Social Classification (NS-SeC)  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons_sixteen_plus  #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   parish_code population_16_and_over ns_sec_L1_3 ns_sec_L4_6 ns_sec_L7 #>   <chr>                        <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 350041                       4548.      0.0818      0.0767    0.0362 #> # ℹ 6 more variables: ns_sec_L8_9 <dbl>, ns_sec_L10_11 <dbl>, ns_sec_L12 <dbl>, #> #   ns_sec_L13 <dbl>, ns_sec_L14 <dbl>, ns_sec_L15 <dbl> #> Parish-level data compiled by the Church of England

title: Reading CoE statistics
text: convenient wrapper around coe_census() getting diocese-level statistics dioceses choosing
code: coe_census_diocese(ons_id = "TS062", diocese_numbers = c(3, 7), relative = TRUE) #> Church of England Census Data #> TS062 - Social Classification (NS-SeC)  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons_sixteen_plus  #> # A tibble: 2 × 12 #>   diocese_name diocese_number population_16_and_over ns_sec_L1_3 ns_sec_L4_6 #>   <chr>                 <dbl>                  <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Blackburn                 3                1124181       0.102       0.191 #> 2 Carlisle                  7                 418322       0.109       0.193 #> # ℹ 7 more variables: ns_sec_L7 <dbl>, ns_sec_L8_9 <dbl>, ns_sec_L10_11 <dbl>, #> #   ns_sec_L12 <dbl>, ns_sec_L13 <dbl>, ns_sec_L14 <dbl>, ns_sec_L15 <dbl>

what: Obtain data for all of England with coe_census_england()
title: Reading CoE statistics
text: convenient wrapper around coe_census() getting national-level stats topic choosing
code: coe_census_england(ons_id = "TS062", relative = TRUE) #> Church of England Census Data #> TS062 - Social Classification (NS-SeC)  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons_sixteen_plus  #> # A tibble: 1 × 10 #>   population_16_and_over ns_sec_L1_3 ns_sec_L4_6 ns_sec_L7 ns_sec_L8_9 #>                    <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1               46006957       0.132       0.199     0.114       0.106 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: ns_sec_L10_11 <dbl>, ns_sec_L12 <dbl>, ns_sec_L13 <dbl>, #> #   ns_sec_L14 <dbl>, ns_sec_L15 <dbl>

what: Compare a parish to it’s diocesan and national context with coe_parish_snapshot()
title: Reading CoE statistics
text: Get contextual ‘snapshot’ given parish number census topics, comparing parochial statistics diocese whole England. wrapper around coe_census_parish(), coe_census_diocese() coe_census_england() obtain relative statistics geography combine single table, iterating census topics return list.
code: coe_parish_snapshot(parish_code = "370047", ons_ids = "TS001") #> ✔ Reading from coedata_parish-data. #> ✔ Range ''TS001''. #> $TS001 #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons  #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   level   level_code level_name                population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>                          <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 parish  370047     South Dulwich: St Stephen       6680                0.983 #> 2 diocese 37         Southwark                    2877245                0.988 #> 3 nation  NA         england                     56490048                0.983 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

title: Reading CoE statistics
code: coe_parish_deprivation("350259") #> ✔ Reading from coe_parish_imd_2019. #> ✔ Range ''imd''. #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   parish_code parish_name         imd_score imd_rank #>         <dbl> <chr>                   <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1      350259 The Vine, Sheffield      30.0     1310  coe_parish_deprivation("350259", domains = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 24 #>   parish_code parish_name         imd_score imd_rank barriers_to_housing_and_s…¹ #>         <dbl> <chr>                   <dbl>    <dbl>                       <dbl> #> 1      350259 The Vine, Sheffield      30.0     1310                        25.0 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​barriers_to_housing_and_services_score #> # ℹ 19 more variables: barriers_to_housing_rank <dbl>, crime_score <dbl>, #> #   crime_rank <dbl>, education_skills_and_training_score <dbl>, #> #   education_skills_and_training_rank <dbl>, #> #   children_and_young_people_rank <dbl>, adult_skills_rank <dbl>, #> #   employment_score_rate <dbl>, employment_rank <dbl>, #> #   geographical_barriers_rank <dbl>, … ## Print method #' @export print.coe_parish_data_imd <- function(x, ...){    cat("Church of England Deprivation Data\n")    NextMethod(x)    if("parish_code" %in% names(x)) cat("Parish-level data compiled by the Church of England") }

what: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: coedata data package serves various datasets made available Church England’s Data Services team. Data sources include: Parish-level 2021 census data database Churches, Parishes, Dioceses geographies (Updated November 2024) Parish-level data 2019 Index Multiple Deprivation (pending) 2021 Census topics made available coedata include: Number usual residents households communal establishments Country birth Age 5 year age bands Ethnic group Religion General health Social Classification (NS-SeC) Economic activity status Highest level qualification Households deprivation dimensions Household language Accommodation type Car van availability Tenure Household composition

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: can install development version coedata GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Church-Army/coedata")

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: Full documentation website : https://Church-Army.github.io/coedata

what: Using coedata to get parish-level census statistics
title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: example use coedata get 2021 census data general health selection parishes. ’ll use neighbouring parishes Stifford: St Mary Grays: St Peter St Paul. get data, ’ll need: parish codes parishes ONS ID general health dataset can find ONS ID general health dataset using coe_datasets(), lists ID every census dataset ’s available package: can see general health data can found dataset ID TS037. Luckily, already know parish codes parishes ’re interested . ’re sure find parish codes need, please refer Finding parish codes. Now ONS ID parish codes, can get census data: parishes central London - densely populated! Note can also get relative statistics data setting relative = TRUE:
code: coe_census_datasets() |>    knitr::kable() coe_census_parish(ons_id = "TS037", parish_codes = c(580342, 580334)) #> ✔ Reading from "coedata_parish-data". #> ✔ Range ''TS037''. #> Church of England Census Data #> TS037 - General health  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   parish_code population general_health_very_good general_health_good #>   <chr>            <dbl>                    <dbl>               <dbl> #> 1 580334           49315                   26735.              16254. #> 2 580342            6332                    2956.               2160. #> # ℹ 3 more variables: general_health_fair <dbl>, general_health_bad <dbl>, #> #   general_health_very_bad <dbl> #> Parish-level data compiled by the Church of England coe_census_parish(ons_id = "TS037", parish_codes = c(580342, 580334), relative = TRUE)  #> Church of England Census Data #> TS037 - General health  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons  #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   parish_code population general_health_very_good general_health_good #>   <chr>            <dbl>                    <dbl>               <dbl> #> 1 580334           49315                    0.542               0.330 #> 2 580342            6332                    0.467               0.341 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: general_health_fair <dbl>, general_health_bad <dbl>, #> #   general_health_very_bad <dbl> #> Parish-level data compiled by the Church of England

what: Viewing a parish in its diocesan and national contexts
title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: Sometimes people want see parish compares diocese nation whole. coedata contains function returns data parish number ONS datasets:
code: coe_parish_snapshot(580342, ons_ids = "TS037") #> $TS037 #> Church of England Census Data #> TS037 - General health  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons  #> # A tibble: 3 × 9 #>   level   level_code level_name        population general_health_very_good #>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>                  <dbl>                    <dbl> #> 1 parish  580342     Stifford: St Mary       6332                    0.467 #> 2 diocese 8          Chelmsford           3281380                    0.497 #> 3 nation  <NA>       england             56490046                    0.485 #> # ℹ 4 more variables: general_health_good <dbl>, general_health_fair <dbl>, #> #   general_health_bad <dbl>, general_health_very_bad <dbl>

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: ’re looking individual parishes coedata, ’ll need identify unique parish codes. ’re sure parish code parish church, can either: Find parish intercative map provided Church England’s Data Services team Find church’s church code clicking ‘information’ Church Near page, use coe_parish_from_church() find ’s parish code.

what: A note on socio-economic classification labels
title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: statistics used package labelled intuitively, using labels like general_health_very_good country_of_birth_middle_east_asia. true socio0economic classification data (TS062), uses labels like ns_sec_L1_3. understand labels, please consult table returned ns_sec_descriptions().

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: census data originally provided Office National Statistics. ONS also maintain nomis service, used source package’s internal data. Ken also maintains parish map Church data read package. Thanks , Ken! Thanks ropensci development maintenance nomisr package, used interface nomis. Thanks Jenny Bryan Posit development maintenance googlesheets4, provided simple, secure way minimising package size storing data remotely.

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: Add IMD data

what: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
text: Get census data Church England parish, diocesan national level.

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
code: coe_census(ons_id, level, areas, relative = FALSE)

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
text: ons_id ONS id required data. Must one coe_census_datasets(). level geographical level data required. Must one 'parish', 'diocese' 'england'. areas character vector parish codes diocese numbers. specified, returned tibble contain data areas. used level = 'england'. NA values removed. relative Logical. returned table contain absolute statitiscs (e.g. persons/households) proportions area?

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
text: tibble::tibble() containing census data Church England

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
code: coe_census(ons_id =  "TS001", level = "england") #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   population lives_in_a_household lives_in_a_communal_establishment #>        <dbl>                <dbl>                             <dbl> #> 1   56490048             55504302                            985746 coe_census(ons_id = "TS001", level = "diocese", areas = 1) #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   diocese_name diocese_number population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>                 <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 Bath & Wells              1     980098               960221 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

what: Get data on the Anglican geography on Church of England Churches, including their parish, benefice, arcdeaconry and diocese. — coe_churches
title: Get data on the Anglican geography on Church of England Churches, including their parish, benefice, arcdeaconry and diocese. — coe_churches
text: Reads church data Church England's Data Services ESRI feature server, dropping spatial data returning tibble::tibble().

code: coe_churches(where = "1=1")

title: Get data on the Anglican geography on Church of England Churches, including their parish, benefice, arcdeaconry and diocese. — coe_churches
text: SQL query. default returns churches. See details.

title: Get data on the Anglican geography on Church of England Churches, including their parish, benefice, arcdeaconry and diocese. — coe_churches
text: tibble row corresponds church Church England

title: Get data on the Anglican geography on Church of England Churches, including their parish, benefice, arcdeaconry and diocese. — coe_churches

code: coe_parish_deprivation(   parish_codes = TRUE,   domains = FALSE,   subdomains = FALSE,   supplementary = FALSE )  coe_parish_imd(   parish_codes = TRUE,   domains = FALSE,   subdomains = FALSE,   supplementary = FALSE )

title: Get parish-level deprivation data from the Church of England — coe_parish_deprivation
text: parish_codes Character vector parish codes return. default (TRUE) returns parish codes. domains Logical. individual domains deprivation included? subdomains Logical. subdomains included? supplementary Logical. supplementary statistics included?

title: Get parish-level deprivation data from the Church of England — coe_parish_deprivation
text: tibble deprivation data one row per parish.

title: Get parish-level deprivation data from the Church of England — coe_parish_deprivation
code: coe_parish_deprivation("350259") #> ✔ Reading from coe_parish_imd_2019. #> ✔ Range ''imd''. #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   parish_code parish_name         imd_score imd_rank #>         <dbl> <chr>                   <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1      350259 The Vine, Sheffield      30.0     1310  coe_parish_deprivation("350259", domains = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 24 #>   parish_code parish_name         imd_score imd_rank barriers_to_housing_and_s…¹ #>         <dbl> <chr>                   <dbl>    <dbl>                       <dbl> #> 1      350259 The Vine, Sheffield      30.0     1310                        25.0 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​barriers_to_housing_and_services_score #> # ℹ 19 more variables: barriers_to_housing_rank <dbl>, crime_score <dbl>, #> #   crime_rank <dbl>, education_skills_and_training_score <dbl>, #> #   education_skills_and_training_rank <dbl>, #> #   children_and_young_people_rank <dbl>, adult_skills_rank <dbl>, #> #   employment_score_rate <dbl>, employment_rank <dbl>, #> #   geographical_barriers_rank <dbl>, …

title: Get a list of comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_snapshot
code: coe_parish_snapshot(parish_code = "370047", ons_ids = "TS001") #> ✔ Reading from coedata_parish-data. #> ✔ Range ''TS001''. #> $TS001 #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons  #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   level   level_code level_name                population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>                          <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 parish  370047     South Dulwich: St Stephen       6680                0.983 #> 2 diocese 37         Southwark                    2877245                0.988 #> 3 nation  NA         england                     56490048                0.983 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl> #>

title: coedata (development version)
text: Diocese-level data now sourced directly weighted summation intersections LLSOAs dioceses. previous method summing parish-level statistics incurred slight rounding error. Parish-level tibbles class "coe_parish_data" now attribute Church England printed.
